article:
'Biomass to Liquid' ('BtL') or BMtL is a multi-step process which produces
liquid biofuels from biomass:

The process uses the whole plant to improve the carbon dioxide balance and
increase yield.
* The FischerâTropsch process is used to produce synfuels from gasified biomass.
  Carbonaceous material is gasified and the gas is processed to make purified
  syngas (a mixture of carbon monoxide and hydrogen). The Fischer-Tropsch
  polymerizes syngas into diesel-range hydrocarbons. While biodiesel and bio-
  ethanol production so far only use parts of a plant, i.e. oil, sugar, starch
  or cellulose, BtL production can gasify and utilize the entire plant.
* Flash pyrolysis - producing bio-oil (pyrolysis oil), char and gas at
  temperatures between 350-550Â°C and residence times
